segment.source: New group policy settings for Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: New group policy settings for Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: New group policy settings for Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: New group policy settings for Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: New group policy settings for Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: New group policy settings for Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11 gives you some new Group Policy settings to help you manage your company's web browser configurations, including:
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11 gives you some new Group Policy settings to help you manage your company's web browser configurations, including:

segment.source: Policy
segment.target: Policy

segment.source: Category Path
segment.target: Category Path

segment.source: Supported on
segment.target: Supported on

segment.source: Explanation
segment.target: Explanation

segment.source: Turn off loading websites and content in the background to optimize performance
segment.target: Turn off loading websites and content in the background to optimize performance

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether Internet Explorer preemptively loads websites and content in the background, speeding up performance such that when the user clicks a hyperlink, the background page seamlessly switches into view.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether Internet Explorer preemptively loads websites and content in the background, speeding up performance such that when the user clicks a hyperlink, the background page seamlessly switches into view.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, IE doesn't load any websites or content in the background.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, IE doesn't load any websites or content in the background.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, IE preemptively loads websites and content in the background.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, IE preemptively loads websites and content in the background.

segment.source: If you don’t configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using IE settings.
segment.target: If you don’t configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using IE settings.

segment.source: This feature is turned on by default.
segment.target: This feature is turned on by default.

segment.source: Allow Microsoft services to provide enhanced suggestions as the user types in the Address bar
segment.target: Allow Microsoft services to provide enhanced suggestions as the user types in the Address bar

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting allows IE to provide enhanced suggestions as the user types in the Address bar.
segment.target: This policy setting allows IE to provide enhanced suggestions as the user types in the Address bar.

segment.source: To provide enhanced suggestions, the user’s keystrokes are sent to Microsoft through Microsoft services.
segment.target: To provide enhanced suggestions, the user’s keystrokes are sent to Microsoft through Microsoft services.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, users receive enhanced suggestions while typing in the Address bar.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, users receive enhanced suggestions while typing in the Address bar.

segment.source: In addition, users won’t be able to change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.
segment.target: In addition, users won’t be able to change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, users won’t receive enhanced suggestions while typing in the Address bar.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, users won’t receive enhanced suggestions while typing in the Address bar.

segment.source: In addition, users won’t be able to change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.
segment.target: In addition, users won’t be able to change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.

segment.source: If you don’t configure this policy setting, users can change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.
segment.target: If you don’t configure this policy setting, users can change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.

segment.source: Turn off phone number detection
segment.target: Turn off phone number detection

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\Advanced settings\Browsing
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\Advanced settings\Browsing

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether phone numbers are recognized and turned into hyperlinks, which can be used to invoke the default phone application on the system.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether phone numbers are recognized and turned into hyperlinks, which can be used to invoke the default phone application on the system.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, phone number detection is turned off.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, phone number detection is turned off.

segment.source: Users won’t be able to modify this setting.
segment.target: Users won’t be able to modify this setting.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, phone number detection is turned on.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, phone number detection is turned on.

segment.source: Users won’t be able to modify this setting.
segment.target: Users won’t be able to modify this setting.

segment.source: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using IE settings.
segment.target: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using IE settings.

segment.source: The default is on.
segment.target: The default is on.

segment.source: Allow IE to use the SPDY/3 network protocol
segment.target: Allow IE to use the SPDY/3 network protocol

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether Internet Explorer uses the SPDY/3 network protocol.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether Internet Explorer uses the SPDY/3 network protocol.

segment.source: SPDY/3 works with HTTP requests to optimize the latency of network requests through compression, multiplexing and prioritization.
segment.target: SPDY/3 works with HTTP requests to optimize the latency of network requests through compression, multiplexing and prioritization.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, Internet Explorer uses the SPDY/3 network protocol.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, Internet Explorer uses the SPDY/3 network protocol.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, Internet Explorer won't use the SPDY/3 network protocol.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, Internet Explorer won't use the SPDY/3 network protocol.

segment.source: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, on the Advanced tab of the Internet Options dialog box. The default is on.NoteWe've replaced the SPDY/3 protocol with the HTTP2 protocol in Windows 10. You can configure the HTTP2 protocol by using the Allow IE to use the HTTP2 network protocol* setting.
segment.target: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, on the Advanced tab of the Internet Options dialog box. The default is on.NoteWe've replaced the SPDY/3 protocol with the HTTP2 protocol in Windows 10. You can configure the HTTP2 protocol by using the Allow IE to use the HTTP2 network protocol* setting.

segment.source: Allow IE to use the HTTP2 network protocol
segment.target: Allow IE to use the HTTP2 network protocol

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether IE uses the HTTP2 network protocol.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether IE uses the HTTP2 network protocol.

segment.source: HTTP2 works with HTTP requests to optimize the latency of network requests through compression, multiplexing, and prioritization.
segment.target: HTTP2 works with HTTP requests to optimize the latency of network requests through compression, multiplexing, and prioritization.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, IE uses the HTTP2 network protocol.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, IE uses the HTTP2 network protocol.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, IE won't use the HTTP2 network protocol.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, IE won't use the HTTP2 network protocol.

segment.source: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using the Internet Explorer Advanced Internet Options settings.
segment.target: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using the Internet Explorer Advanced Internet Options settings.

segment.source: The default is on.
segment.target: The default is on.

segment.source: Don't run antimalware programs against ActiveX controls
segment.target: Don't run antimalware programs against ActiveX controls

segment.source: (Internet, Restricted Zones)
segment.target: (Internet, Restricted Zones)

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Internet Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Internet Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Restricted Sites Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Restricted Sites Zone

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether IE runs antimalware programs against ActiveX controls, to check if they're safe to load on pages.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether IE runs antimalware programs against ActiveX controls, to check if they're safe to load on pages.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, IE won't check with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, IE won't check with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, IE always checks with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, IE always checks with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.

segment.source: If you don't configure this policy setting, IE always checks with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.
segment.target: If you don't configure this policy setting, IE always checks with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.

segment.source: Users can turn this behavior on or off, using the Internet Explorer's Security settings.
segment.target: Users can turn this behavior on or off, using the Internet Explorer's Security settings.

segment.source: Don't run antimalware programs against ActiveX controls
segment.target: Don't run antimalware programs against ActiveX controls

segment.source: (Intranet, Trusted, Local Machine Zones)
segment.target: (Intranet, Trusted, Local Machine Zones)

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Intranet Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Intranet Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Local Machine Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Local Machine Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Local Machine Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Local Machine Zone

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether IE runs antimalware programs against ActiveX controls, to check if they're safe to load on pages.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether IE runs antimalware programs against ActiveX controls, to check if they're safe to load on pages.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, IE won't check with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, IE won't check with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, IE always checks with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, IE always checks with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.

segment.source: If you don't configure this policy setting, IE won't check with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.
segment.target: If you don't configure this policy setting, IE won't check with your antimalware program to see if it's safe to create an instance of the ActiveX control.

segment.source: Users can turn this behavior on or off, using Internet Explorer's Security settings.
segment.target: Users can turn this behavior on or off, using Internet Explorer's Security settings.

segment.source: Turn on 64-bit tab processes when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows
segment.target: Turn on 64-bit tab processes when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether IE11 uses 64-bit processes (for greater security) or 32-bit processes (for greater compatibility) when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether IE11 uses 64-bit processes (for greater security) or 32-bit processes (for greater compatibility) when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, IE11 will use 64-bit tab processes when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, IE11 will use 64-bit tab processes when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, IE11 will use 32-bit tab processes when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, IE11 will use 32-bit tab processes when running in Enhanced Protected Mode on 64-bit versions of Windows.

segment.source: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this feature on or off using IE settings.
segment.target: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this feature on or off using IE settings.

segment.source: This feature is turned off by default.
segment.target: This feature is turned off by default.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When using 64-bit processes, some ActiveX controls and toolbars might not be available.
segment.target: When using 64-bit processes, some ActiveX controls and toolbars might not be available.

segment.source: Turn off sending UTF-8 query strings for URLs
segment.target: Turn off sending UTF-8 query strings for URLs

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether IE uses 8-bit Unicode Transformation Format (UTF-8) to encode query strings in URLs before sending them to servers or to proxy servers.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether IE uses 8-bit Unicode Transformation Format (UTF-8) to encode query strings in URLs before sending them to servers or to proxy servers.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, you must specify when to use UTF-8 to encode query strings:
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, you must specify when to use UTF-8 to encode query strings:

segment.source: 0. Never encode query strings.
segment.target: 0. Never encode query strings.

segment.source: 1. Only encode query strings for URLs that aren't in the Intranet zone.
segment.target: 1. Only encode query strings for URLs that aren't in the Intranet zone.

segment.source: 2. Only encode query strings for URLs that are in the Intranet zone.
segment.target: 2. Only encode query strings for URLs that are in the Intranet zone.

segment.source: 3. Always encode query strings.
segment.target: 3. Always encode query strings.

segment.source: If you disable or don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using IE Advanced Options settings.
segment.target: If you disable or don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using IE Advanced Options settings.

segment.source: The default is to encode all query strings in UTF-8.
segment.target: The default is to encode all query strings in UTF-8.

segment.source: Turn off sending URL path as UTF-8
segment.target: Turn off sending URL path as UTF-8

segment.source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\URL Encoding
segment.target: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\URL Encoding

segment.source: At least Windows Internet Explorer 7
segment.target: At least Windows Internet Explorer 7

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether to let IE send the path portion of a URL using the UTF-8 standard.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether to let IE send the path portion of a URL using the UTF-8 standard.

segment.source: This standard defines characters so they're readable in any language and lets you exchange Internet addresses (URLs) with characters included in any language.
segment.target: This standard defines characters so they're readable in any language and lets you exchange Internet addresses (URLs) with characters included in any language.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, UTF-8 is not allowed.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, UTF-8 is not allowed.

segment.source: Users won't be able to change this setting.
segment.target: Users won't be able to change this setting.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, UTF-8 is allowed.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, UTF-8 is allowed.

segment.source: Users won't be able to change this setting.
segment.target: Users won't be able to change this setting.

segment.source: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off.
segment.target: If you don't configure this policy setting, users can turn this behavior on or off.

segment.source: Turn off the flip ahead with page prediction feature
segment.target: Turn off the flip ahead with page prediction feature

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

segment.source: At least Internet Explorer 10 on Windows 8
segment.target: At least Internet Explorer 10 on Windows 8

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether a user can swipe across a screen or click Forward to go to the next pre-loaded page of a website.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether a user can swipe across a screen or click Forward to go to the next pre-loaded page of a website.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, flip ahead with page prediction is turned off and the next webpage isn’t loaded into the background.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, flip ahead with page prediction is turned off and the next webpage isn’t loaded into the background.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, flip ahead with page prediction is turned on and the next webpage is loaded into the background.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, flip ahead with page prediction is turned on and the next webpage is loaded into the background.

segment.source: If you don’t configure this setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using the Settings charm.
segment.target: If you don’t configure this setting, users can turn this behavior on or off, using the Settings charm.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Microsoft collects your browsing history to improve how flip ahead with page prediction works.
segment.target: Microsoft collects your browsing history to improve how flip ahead with page prediction works.

segment.source: This feature isn’t available for Internet Explorer for the desktop.
segment.target: This feature isn’t available for Internet Explorer for the desktop.

segment.source: Prevent deleting ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection and Do Not Track data
segment.target: Prevent deleting ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection and Do Not Track data

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Delete Browsing History
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Delete Browsing History

segment.source: At least Windows Internet Explorer 9
segment.target: At least Windows Internet Explorer 9

segment.source: In Internet Explorer 9 and Internet Explorer 10:
segment.target: In Internet Explorer 9 and Internet Explorer 10:

segment.source: This policy setting prevents users from deleting ActiveX Filtering and Tracking Protection data, which includes the list of websites for which the user has chosen to disable ActiveX Filtering or Tracking Protection.
segment.target: This policy setting prevents users from deleting ActiveX Filtering and Tracking Protection data, which includes the list of websites for which the user has chosen to disable ActiveX Filtering or Tracking Protection.

segment.source: In addition, Tracking Protection data is also collected if users turn on the Personalized Tracking Protection List, which blocks third-party items while the user is browsing.
segment.target: In addition, Tracking Protection data is also collected if users turn on the Personalized Tracking Protection List, which blocks third-party items while the user is browsing.

segment.source: In IE11:
segment.target: In IE11:

segment.source: This policy setting prevents users from deleting ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection data, and Do Not Track exceptions, stored in the Delete Browsing History dialog box, for visited websites.
segment.target: This policy setting prevents users from deleting ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection data, and Do Not Track exceptions, stored in the Delete Browsing History dialog box, for visited websites.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection and Do Not Track data is preserved when the user clicks Delete.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection and Do Not Track data is preserved when the user clicks Delete.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection and Do Not Track data is deleted when the user clicks Delete.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection and Do Not Track data is deleted when the user clicks Delete.

segment.source: If you don’t configure this policy setting, users can turn this feature on and off, determining whether to delete ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection, and Do Not Track data when clicking Delete.
segment.target: If you don’t configure this policy setting, users can turn this feature on and off, determining whether to delete ActiveX Filtering, Tracking Protection, and Do Not Track data when clicking Delete.

segment.source: Always send Do Not Track header
segment.target: Always send Do Not Track header

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

segment.source: At least Internet Explorer 10
segment.target: At least Internet Explorer 10

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to configure how IE sends the Do Not Track (DNT) header.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to configure how IE sends the Do Not Track (DNT) header.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, IE sends a header with all HTTP and HTTPS requests.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, IE sends a header with all HTTP and HTTPS requests.

segment.source: The header signals to the servers not to track the user.
segment.target: The header signals to the servers not to track the user.

segment.source: In Internet Explorer 9 and 10:
segment.target: In Internet Explorer 9 and 10:

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, IE only sends the Do Not Track header if a Tracking Protection List is enabled or inPrivate Browsing mode is used.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, IE only sends the Do Not Track header if a Tracking Protection List is enabled or inPrivate Browsing mode is used.

segment.source: In at least IE11:
segment.target: In at least IE11:

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, IE only sends the Do Not Track header if inPrivate Browsing mode is used.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, IE only sends the Do Not Track header if inPrivate Browsing mode is used.

segment.source: If you don't configure the policy setting, users can select the Always send Do Not Track header option on the Advanced tab of the Internet Options* dialog box.
segment.target: If you don't configure the policy setting, users can select the Always send Do Not Track header option on the Advanced tab of the Internet Options* dialog box.

segment.source: By selecting this option, IE sends a header with all HTTP and HTTPS requests; unless the user grants a site-specific exception, in which case IE sends a header.
segment.target: By selecting this option, IE sends a header with all HTTP and HTTPS requests; unless the user grants a site-specific exception, in which case IE sends a header.

segment.source: By default, this option is enabled.
segment.target: By default, this option is enabled.

segment.source: Turn off the ability to launch report site problems using a menu option
segment.target: Turn off the ability to launch report site problems using a menu option

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Browser menus
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Browser menus

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can start the eport Site Problems dialog box from the Internet Explorer settings area or from the Tools menu.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can start the eport Site Problems dialog box from the Internet Explorer settings area or from the Tools menu.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, users won’t be able to start the Report Site Problems dialog box from the Internet Explorer settings or the Tools menu.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, users won’t be able to start the Report Site Problems dialog box from the Internet Explorer settings or the Tools menu.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this policy setting, users will be able to start the Report Site Problems dialog box from the Internet Explorer settings area or from the Tools menu.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this policy setting, users will be able to start the Report Site Problems dialog box from the Internet Explorer settings area or from the Tools menu.

segment.source: Allow only approved domains to use the TDC ActiveX control
segment.target: Allow only approved domains to use the TDC ActiveX control

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Intranet Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Intranet Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Local Machine Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Local Machine Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Local Machine Zone
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Local Machine Zone

segment.source: IE11 in Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 in Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether users can run the Tabular Data Control (TDC) ActiveX control, based on security zone.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether users can run the Tabular Data Control (TDC) ActiveX control, based on security zone.

segment.source: By default, the TDC ActiveX Control is disabled in the Internet and Restricted Sites security zones.
segment.target: By default, the TDC ActiveX Control is disabled in the Internet and Restricted Sites security zones.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, users won’t be able to run the TDC ActiveX control from all sites in the specified zone.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, users won’t be able to run the TDC ActiveX control from all sites in the specified zone.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, users can run the TDC Active X control from all sites in the specified zone.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, users can run the TDC Active X control from all sites in the specified zone.

segment.source: Turn on Site Discovery XML output
segment.target: Turn on Site Discovery XML output

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: At least Internet Explorer 8
segment.target: At least Internet Explorer 8

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to manage the XML output functionality of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to manage the XML output functionality of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit will log its collected data to an XML file, stored in your specified location.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit will log its collected data to an XML file, stored in your specified location.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit won’t log its collected data to an XML file.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit won’t log its collected data to an XML file.

segment.source: Note:
segment.target: Note:

segment.source: Enabling or disabling this setting won’t impact any other output methods available to the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: Enabling or disabling this setting won’t impact any other output methods available to the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: Turn on Site Discovery WMI output
segment.target: Turn on Site Discovery WMI output

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: At least Internet Explorer 8
segment.target: At least Internet Explorer 8

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to manage the WMI output functionality of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to manage the WMI output functionality of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit will log its collected data to an WMI class, which can be aggregated by using a client-management solution, such as System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit will log its collected data to an WMI class, which can be aggregated by using a client-management solution, such as System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit won’t log its collected data to an WMI class.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit won’t log its collected data to an WMI class.

segment.source: Note:
segment.target: Note:

segment.source: Enabling or disabling this setting won’t impact any other output methods available to the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: Enabling or disabling this setting won’t impact any other output methods available to the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: Limit Site Discovery output by Domain
segment.target: Limit Site Discovery output by Domain

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: At least Internet Explorer 8
segment.target: At least Internet Explorer 8

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to control which domains are included in the discovery function of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to control which domains are included in the discovery function of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all sites in your specified domains, configured by adding one domain per line to the included text box.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all sites in your specified domains, configured by adding one domain per line to the included text box.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all sites in all domains.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all sites in all domains.

segment.source: Note:
segment.target: Note:

segment.source: You can use this setting in conjunction with the other settings that control the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: You can use this setting in conjunction with the other settings that control the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: Limit Site Discovery output by Zone
segment.target: Limit Site Discovery output by Zone

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: At least Internet Explorer 8
segment.target: At least Internet Explorer 8

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to control which zones are included in the discovery function of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to control which zones are included in the discovery function of the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all specified security zones.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all specified security zones.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all sites in all security zones.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit collects data from all sites in all security zones.

segment.source: To specify which zones can collect data, you must include a binary number that represents your selected zones, based on this order:
segment.target: To specify which zones can collect data, you must include a binary number that represents your selected zones, based on this order:

segment.source: 0 – Restricted Sites zone
segment.target: 0 – Restricted Sites zone

segment.source: 0 – Internet zone
segment.target: 0 – Internet zone

segment.source: 0 – Trusted Sites zone
segment.target: 0 – Trusted Sites zone

segment.source: 0 – Local Intranet zone
segment.target: 0 – Local Intranet zone

segment.source: 0 – Local Machine zone
segment.target: 0 – Local Machine zone

segment.source: Example 1: Include only the Local Intranet zone (binary representation: 00010), based on:
segment.target: Example 1: Include only the Local Intranet zone (binary representation: 00010), based on:

segment.source: 0 – Restricted Sites zone
segment.target: 0 – Restricted Sites zone

segment.source: 0 – Internet zone
segment.target: 0 – Internet zone

segment.source: 0 – Trusted Sites zone
segment.target: 0 – Trusted Sites zone

segment.source: 1 – Local Intranet zone
segment.target: 1 – Local Intranet zone

segment.source: 0 – Local Machine zone
segment.target: 0 – Local Machine zone

segment.source: Example 2: Include only the Restricted Sites, Trusted Sites, and Local Intranet zones (binary representation: 10110), based on:
segment.target: Example 2: Include only the Restricted Sites, Trusted Sites, and Local Intranet zones (binary representation: 10110), based on:

segment.source: 1 – Restricted Sites zone
segment.target: 1 – Restricted Sites zone

segment.source: 0 – Internet zone
segment.target: 0 – Internet zone

segment.source: 1 – Trusted Sites zone
segment.target: 1 – Trusted Sites zone

segment.source: 1 – Local Intranet zone
segment.target: 1 – Local Intranet zone

segment.source: 1 – Local Machine zone
segment.target: 1 – Local Machine zone

segment.source: Note:
segment.target: Note:

segment.source: You can use this setting in conjunction with the other settings that control the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.
segment.target: You can use this setting in conjunction with the other settings that control the Internet Explorer Site Discovery Toolkit.

segment.source: Allow SSL3 Fallback
segment.target: Allow SSL3 Fallback

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11 on Windows 10
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to stop websites from falling back to using Secure Socket Layer (SSL) 3.0 or lower, if Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.0 or higher, fails.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to stop websites from falling back to using Secure Socket Layer (SSL) 3.0 or lower, if Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.0 or higher, fails.

segment.source: This setting doesn’t affect which security protocols are enabled.
segment.target: This setting doesn’t affect which security protocols are enabled.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting and a website fails while using the TLS 1.0 or higher security protocols, Internet Explorer will try to fallback and use SSL 3.0 or lower security protocols.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting and a website fails while using the TLS 1.0 or higher security protocols, Internet Explorer will try to fallback and use SSL 3.0 or lower security protocols.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, Internet Explorer uses the default system protocols.Important:
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, Internet Explorer uses the default system protocols.Important:

segment.source: By default, SSL 3.0 is disabled.
segment.target: By default, SSL 3.0 is disabled.

segment.source: If you choose to enable SSL 3.0, we recommend that you disable or don't configure this setting to help mitigate potential man-in-the-middle attacks.
segment.target: If you choose to enable SSL 3.0, we recommend that you disable or don't configure this setting to help mitigate potential man-in-the-middle attacks.

segment.source: Turn off automatic download of the ActiveX VersionList
segment.target: Turn off automatic download of the ActiveX VersionList

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Add-on Management
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Add-on Management

segment.source: At least Windows Internet Explorer 8
segment.target: At least Windows Internet Explorer 8

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to decide whether Internet Explorer automatically downloads updated versions of Microsoft's VersionList.XML file.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to decide whether Internet Explorer automatically downloads updated versions of Microsoft's VersionList.XML file.

segment.source: This file tells Internet Explorer whether to stop specific ActiveX controls from loading.
segment.target: This file tells Internet Explorer whether to stop specific ActiveX controls from loading.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, Internet Explorer stops automatically downloading updated versions of the VersionList.XML file.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, Internet Explorer stops automatically downloading updated versions of the VersionList.XML file.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, Internet Explorer continues to download updated versions of the VersionList.XML file.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this setting, Internet Explorer continues to download updated versions of the VersionList.XML file.

segment.source: Important:
segment.target: Important:

segment.source: Stopping this file from updating breaks the out-of-date ActiveX control blocking feature, potentially compromising the security of the device.
segment.target: Stopping this file from updating breaks the out-of-date ActiveX control blocking feature, potentially compromising the security of the device.

segment.source: For more info, see the Out-of-Date ActiveX Control Blocking (https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/itpro/internet-explorer/ie11-deploy-guide/out-of-date-activex-control-blocking) topic.
segment.target: For more info, see the Out-of-Date ActiveX Control Blocking (https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/itpro/internet-explorer/ie11-deploy-guide/out-of-date-activex-control-blocking) topic.

segment.source: Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu
segment.target: Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10

segment.source: This policy setting lets you decide whether users can turn on Enterprise Mode for websites with compatibility issues.
segment.target: This policy setting lets you decide whether users can turn on Enterprise Mode for websites with compatibility issues.

segment.source: Optionally, this policy also lets you specify where to get reports (through post messages) about the websites for which users turn on Enterprise Mode using the Tools menu.
segment.target: Optionally, this policy also lets you specify where to get reports (through post messages) about the websites for which users turn on Enterprise Mode using the Tools menu.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, users can see and use the Enterprise Mode option from the Tools menu.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, users can see and use the Enterprise Mode option from the Tools menu.

segment.source: If you enable this setting, but don’t specify a report location, Enterprise Mode will still be available to your users, but you won’t get any reports.
segment.target: If you enable this setting, but don’t specify a report location, Enterprise Mode will still be available to your users, but you won’t get any reports.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this policy setting, the menu option won’t appear and users won’t be able to turn on Enterprise Mode locally.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this policy setting, the menu option won’t appear and users won’t be able to turn on Enterprise Mode locally.

segment.source: Use the Enterprise Mode IE website list
segment.target: Use the Enterprise Mode IE website list

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10, version 1511
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10, version 1511

segment.source: This policy setting lets you specify where to find the list of websites you want opened using Enterprise Mode, instead of Standard mode, because of compatibility issues.
segment.target: This policy setting lets you specify where to find the list of websites you want opened using Enterprise Mode, instead of Standard mode, because of compatibility issues.

segment.source: Users can’t edit this list.
segment.target: Users can’t edit this list.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, Internet Explorer downloads the Enterprise Mode website list from the \Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main\EnterpriseMode hive, opening all included websites using Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, Internet Explorer downloads the Enterprise Mode website list from the \Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main\EnterpriseMode hive, opening all included websites using Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: We recommend storing and downloading your list from a secure web server , to help protect against data tampering.
segment.target: We recommend storing and downloading your list from a secure web server , to help protect against data tampering.

segment.source: If you disable or don’t configure this policy setting, Internet Explorer opens all websites using Standard mode.
segment.target: If you disable or don’t configure this policy setting, Internet Explorer opens all websites using Standard mode.

segment.source: Send all sites not included in the Enterprise Mode Site List to Microsoft Edge
segment.target: Send all sites not included in the Enterprise Mode Site List to Microsoft Edge

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10, version 1607
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10, version 1607

segment.source: This policy setting lets you decide whether to open all sites that aren’t specified to open in IE11 by the Enterprise Mode site list, to open in Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: This policy setting lets you decide whether to open all sites that aren’t specified to open in IE11 by the Enterprise Mode site list, to open in Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, you must also enable the Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Use the Enterprise Mode IE website list policy setting and you must include at least one site in the Enterprise Mode site list.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, you must also enable the Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Use the Enterprise Mode IE website list policy setting and you must include at least one site in the Enterprise Mode site list.

segment.source: If you disable or don't configure this policy setting, all sites will open based on the currently active browser.
segment.target: If you disable or don't configure this policy setting, all sites will open based on the currently active browser.

segment.source: Note:
segment.target: Note:

segment.source: If you’ve also enabled the Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Edge\Send all intranet sites to Internet Explorer 11 policy setting, then all intranet sites will continue to open in Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: If you’ve also enabled the Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Edge\Send all intranet sites to Internet Explorer 11 policy setting, then all intranet sites will continue to open in Internet Explorer 11.

segment.source: Show message when opening sites in Microsoft Edge using Enterprise Mode
segment.target: Show message when opening sites in Microsoft Edge using Enterprise Mode

segment.source: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer
segment.target: Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

segment.source: IE11 on Windows 10, version 1607
segment.target: IE11 on Windows 10, version 1607

segment.source: This policy setting lets you decide whether employees see an additional page in Internet Explorer 11, stating that a site has been opened using Microsoft Edge with Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: This policy setting lets you decide whether employees see an additional page in Internet Explorer 11, stating that a site has been opened using Microsoft Edge with Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, employees see an additional page in Internet Explorer 11, stating that a site has been opened using Microsoft Edge with Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, employees see an additional page in Internet Explorer 11, stating that a site has been opened using Microsoft Edge with Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: If you disable or don't configure this policy setting, the default app behavior occurs and no additional page appears.
segment.target: If you disable or don't configure this policy setting, the default app behavior occurs and no additional page appears.

segment.source: Removed Group Policy settings
segment.target: Removed Group Policy settings

segment.source: IE11 no longer supports these Group Policy settings:
segment.target: IE11 no longer supports these Group Policy settings:

segment.source: Turn on Internet Explorer 7 Standards Mode
segment.target: Turn on Internet Explorer 7 Standards Mode

segment.source: Turn off Compatibility View button
segment.target: Turn off Compatibility View button

segment.source: Turn off Quick Tabs functionality
segment.target: Turn off Quick Tabs functionality

segment.source: Turn off the quick pick menu
segment.target: Turn off the quick pick menu

segment.source: Use large icons for command buttons
segment.target: Use large icons for command buttons

segment.source: Viewing your policy settings
segment.target: Viewing your policy settings

segment.source: After you've finished updating and deploying your Group Policy, you can use the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to view your settings.
segment.target: After you've finished updating and deploying your Group Policy, you can use the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to view your settings.

segment.source: To use the RSoP snap-in
segment.target: To use the RSoP snap-in

segment.source: Open and run the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) wizard, specifying the information you want to see.
segment.target: Open and run the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) wizard, specifying the information you want to see.

segment.source: Open your wizard results in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: Open your wizard results in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: For complete instructions about how to add, open, and use RSoP, see Use the RSoP Snap-in
segment.target: For complete instructions about how to add, open, and use RSoP, see Use the RSoP Snap-in
